title: Check for a Balanced Equation
text: Check if the equation is balanced or not. If not, balance the equation.

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of $$Fe_2 O_3$$
text: Use the equation Moles of Reactant A $$=$$ (Mass of Reactant A)*(Moles of Reactant A)/(Molar Mass of Reactant A).

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of $$Fe_2 O_3$$
text: What is $$(25.13$$ g $$Fe_2 O_3$$ )*(1 mol $$Fe_2 O_3$$ / $$159.7$$ g $$Fe_2 O_3$$ )? Keep three decimal places.

title: Identify the Stoichiometric Factor
text: The stoichiometric factor relating the two substances of interest is $$3$$ mol CO / $$1$$ mol $$Fe_2 O_3$$.

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of CO
text: The molar amount of CO is derived by multiplying the provided molar amount of $$Fe_2 O_3$$ by multiplying the stoichiometric factor.

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of CO
text: What is $$(0.157$$ mol $$Fe_2 O_3$$ )*(3 mol CO / $$1$$ mol $$Fe_2 O_3$$ )? Keep three decimal places.

title: Calculate the Mass of CO
text: Calculate the Mass of CO with Mass of Reactant A $$=$$ (Molar Mass of Reactant A)/(Moles of Reactant A)**(Moles of Reactant A).

title: Calculate the Mass of CO
text: What is $$(0.471$$ mol CO)*(28.01 g CO)/(mol CO))? Give your answer as an integer.
